content.text: is designed to handle the processing of account billing rebills for the New York Power Authority (NYPA). It identifies and processes missing billing records for accounts that have undergone adjustments but do not have corresponding billing records in the system. The procedure involves several steps, including checking for existing cycle parameters, inserting missing billing records into a temporary table, and updating the main billing tables with these records.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to the following reasons:
It involves multiple SQL operations, including
It uses several joins across different tables, which increases the complexity of understanding the data flow.
The procedure includes conditional logic and multiple steps that require careful coordination.
It interacts with various tables and requires maintaining data integrity across these tables.
: This parameter represents the ID of the user who is authenticated and executing the procedure. It is used for tracking purposes in the database.
: This is an output parameter that shows the execution status of the procedure. It returns
: The procedure begins by declaring and initializing several local variables that will be used throughout the process.

: It checks if the upload cycle parameters exist for a specific utility company and invoice account group. If they exist, it retrieves billing-related dates; otherwise, it assumes default dates based on the billing period.
table and resets its identity seed. This table is used to temporarily store billing adjustments that need to be processed.
table for adjustments that do not have corresponding billing records.
: It deletes records from the temporary table that already have corresponding billing records in the main billing table.
: The procedure inserts missing billing records into the
table, setting specific fields to indicate that these are back-billed records.
table to mark adjustments as processed and associates them with the newly created billing records.
: If there are back-billed records, it inserts corresponding records into the
table and updates the adjustment records with the new electric billing information.
table is efficient for clearing data but requires careful handling to ensure no unintended data loss.
: The procedure involves multiple joins and subqueries, which can be resource-intensive, especially if the tables involved are large.
: Proper indexing on the tables involved in joins and where clauses can significantly improve performance.
: If the volume of data is large, consider processing in batches to reduce transaction size and lock contention.
: The procedure modifies multiple tables, which could lead to data integrity issues if not handled correctly, especially in the case of failures or partial updates.
: The procedure may face concurrency issues if multiple instances are executed simultaneously, potentially leading to race conditions or deadlocks.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling mechanisms, which could result in unhandled exceptions and inconsistent states.
: As the data volume grows, the complexity and resource demands of the procedure may increase, potentially impacting performance and scalability.

--**************************************************************************************
--* Description: Process the NYPA account billing rebills bills. The sequential processing steps needed to
--* Exec: usp_ProcessAccountBillingRebills
--* Parameter(s): 
--* BillingPeriod varchar(6) - Current billing period
--* StatusCode int output - Execution Return Status 
--* Return:	0 Success
--* 9 Failure
--* AUTHOR: Peter Heller (PAH)
--* Created On: 10/26/2005
--**************************************************************************************
--* Date Tech Description of Change
--* ---------- ---- -------------------------------------------------------------
--* 10/26/2005 PAH First Version 
--* 03/27/2006 PAH Revised to 
--* 2018-11-21	ZD	I added a update to target unique account stting 
--					This modification will help process to choose the rigt account
--* 12/3/2018   VY  Modified for UniqueAccountSeqID
--* 12/20/2018  VY  Modified for updating UniqueAccountSeqID
--***************************************************************************************
CREATE PROCEDURE [Nypa].[usp_ProcessAccountBillingRebillAddMissingBills]
(
	@AuthenticatedUserID AS INT,
	@StatusCode AS INT OUTPUT
)
AS
BEGIN
	DECLARE @AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid AS INT, @AdjustedAccountBill AS INT,
		@InvoiceTrackingSeqid AS INT, @CurrentAccountSeqid AS INT,
		@CurrentAccountBillingSeqid AS INT, @CurrentAccountBillingElectricSeqid AS INT,
		@UtililtyCompanyCycleParametersExist AS INT,@Zero AS INT, @ToDateParm varchar(1),
		@FromDateParm varchar(1), @CurrentBillingPeriod varchar(6), @BillingPeriod varchar(6),
		@RevisedBillingPeriod varchar(6), @BillCreationDate varchar(6), @OriginalBilledAmountSetToZero MONEY,
		@PostMarkDate varchar(8), @DatePaymentDue varchar(8), @DateAcceptanceIntoOEC varchar(8),
		@Yes varchar(1), @NumberOfBackBilledRecords INT, @NumberOfBackBilledElectricRecords INT,
		@NumberOfBackBilledAdjustmentElectricRecords INT;

	SELECT @InvoiceTrackingSeqid = null, @ToDateParm = 'T', @FromDateParm = 'F',
		@OriginalBilledAmountSetToZero = 0.00, @Zero = 0.00, @NumberOfBackBilledElectricRecords = 0,
		@NumberOfBackBilledAdjustmentElectricRecords = 0, @Yes = 'Y';

	-- Check if the Upload Cycle parameters exist
	SELECT @UtililtyCompanyCycleParametersExist = COUNT(*)
	FROM
		Common.UploadCycleParameters INNER JOIN
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Common.UploadCycleParameters.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
	WHERE
		(Common.UploadCycleParameters.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7) AND 
		(Common.UploadCycleParameters.InvoiceAccountGroupSeqid = 1) AND 
		(Common.UploadCycleParameters.CanProcessData = @Yes) and 
		(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = @Yes)

	IF (@UtililtyCompanyCycleParametersExist = 1)
	BEGIN
		SELECT DISTINCT @BillCreationDate = BillCreationDate, @PostMarkDate = PostMarkDate, @DatePaymentDue = DatePaymentDue,@DateAcceptanceIntoOEC = DateAcceptanceIntoOEC
		FROM 
			Common.UploadCycleParameters
		WHERE 
			(Common.UploadCycleParameters.UtilityCompanySeqid = 7) AND (Common.UploadCycleParameters.InvoiceAccountGroupSeqid=1) and 
			(Common.UploadCycleParameters.BillingPeriod =@BillingPeriod) AND (Common.UploadCycleParameters.CanProcessData = @Yes)
	END;
	ELSE
	BEGIN
		-- If the parameters do not exist, assume that the bill was processed mid month.
		-- This should only occur in revisions to accounts prior to the legacy conversion 
		-- period

		set @BillCreationDate = @BillingPeriod+'05'
		set @PostMarkDate = @BillingPeriod+'06'
		set @DatePaymentDue = @BillingPeriod+'15'
		set @DateAcceptanceIntoOEC = @BillingPeriod+'07'
	END;

	-- Find all adjustments for the period and load them into the UploadNypaBackAccountBilling table
	-- then find all of the adjustment that have acorresponding accountbilling row and delete them from
	-- UploadNypaBackAccountBilling table. The remainder are the bills that do not exist in EC3 as previously
	-- billed.

	TRUNCATE table UploadNypaBackAccountBilling
	DBCC CHECKIDENT ('[Nypa].[UploadNypaBackAccountBilling]', RESEED,0)

	INSERT INTO Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling
		(AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, AccountOriginalAccountNumber, 
		AccountSeqid, AccountBillingStatus, UniqueAccountSeqID)
	SELECT 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid,
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, 
		A.OriginalAccountNumber AS AccountOriginalAccountNumber, 
		A.AccountSeqid,'BA' as AccountBillingStatus,
		A.UniqueAccountSeqid /* added on 12/14/2018 */
	FROM 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric
		INNER JOIN Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision <> Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod
		INNER JOIN Billing.Account AS A ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid = A.UtilityAccountProvider AND 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalAccountNumber = A.OriginalAccountNumber
	WHERE (Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y')

	DELETE from Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling
	FROM 
		Billing.Account AS A INNER JOIN
		Billing.AccountBilling AS AB ON A.UniqueAccountSeqid = AB.UniqueAccountSeqId AND A.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added 12/3/2018 for UniqueAccountSeqID */
		INNER JOIN Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling ON AB.OriginalAccountNumber = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.AccountOriginalAccountNumber AND 
		AB.BillingPeriod = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
		AB.BillingPeriodRevision = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
		A.AccountSeqid = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.AccountSeqid

	-- The status for a missing bill is as follows: BA,NB and the CurrentBillingPeriod that the adjustment
	-- has occurred.
	INSERT INTO Billing.AccountBilling
		(OriginalAccountNumber,UploadFileSeqid,AccountSeqid, InvoiceTrackingSeqid, PreviousBillingPeriod, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, NextBillingPeriod, CurrentInvoiceAccountBillingGroup, 
		ManualDataEntry, ManualPaymentOverride, AccountBillingStatus, PreviousAccountBillingStatus, AccountBillingStatusCodePeriod, 
		ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, BillingCycle, SalesType, AccountEnergyUsage, 
		AccountDemandUsage, EnergySource, ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, 
		BillingPeriodDays, FromDate, ToDate, BillingAction, OriginalBilledAmount, ManualPaymentOverrideAmount, RevisedBilledAmount, TotalAmountDue, 
		OriginalBilledAmountPaid, PaidAdjustmentAmount, SplitFiscalYear, ChargeToFiscalYear, ChargeToPriorFiscalYear, AuthenticatedUserID, 
		InitialPostingDate, DateAdded, LastUpdate,CurrentAccountBillingInvoiceContractBudgetLine,LastPeriodModified, IsTimeOfDayAccount, UtilityCompanySeqid)
	SELECT DISTINCT
		A.OriginalAccountNumber,
		null, -- Need to fix this @AccountBillingAjustmentSeqid,
		A.AccountSeqid, 
		null, -- Insert a null for the InvoiceTracking sequence id 
		[dbo].[CreatePreviousPeriodForExchanges] (@BillingPeriod, A.BillingCycle, A.AccountStatus), -- 	AccountBilling.PreviousBillingPeriod
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, -- Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, 
		[dbo].[CreateNextPeriodForExchanges] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision,A.BillingCycle,A.AccountStatus), -- Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.NextBillingPeriod
		A.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup,
		'N',
		'N',
		'BA',
		'NB',
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod,
		'Y',
		A.BillingCycle, A.SalesType, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountEnergyUsage, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountDemandUsage, 
		A.EnergySource, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, 
		[dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays](Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate,Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate), --Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodDays, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingAction,
		@OriginalBilledAmountSetToZero,
		0.00,
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.TotalReBilledAmount,
		0.00,
		@OriginalBilledAmountSetToZero, --Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingAmount since this is a back billing only, zero billed originally
		@OriginalBilledAmountSetToZero, --AccountBilling.PaidAdjustmentAmount, since this is a back billing only, zero billed originally
		[dbo].[IsFiscalYearSplit] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate),
		[dbo].[CalculateFiscalYearIfSplit] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate,@ToDateParm),
		[dbo].[CalculateFiscalYearIfSplit] (Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.FromDate, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.ToDate,@FromDateParm),
		@AuthenticatedUserID,
		@BillCreationDate,
		getdate(), getdate(),
		A.AgencyEnergyBillingBudgetLine,
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsTimeOfDayAccount, 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid
	FROM 
		Billing.Account AS A INNER JOIN
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric INNER JOIN
		Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision <> Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod ON 
		A.UtilityAccountProvider = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid AND 
		A.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalAccountNumber INNER JOIN
		Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling ON /* A.AccountSeqid = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.AccountSeqid */
		A.UniqueAccountSeqid = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqID AND  A.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' AND /* Added on 12/13/2018 */
		Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid
	WHERE (Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y')

	SET @NumberOfBackBilledRecords = @@rowcount

	/* added on 12/20/2018 */
	UPDATE AB SET UniqueAccountSeqID = A.UniqueAccountSeqid
	FROM Billing.AccountBilling AS AB INNER JOIN Billing.Account AS A ON AB.AccountSeqID = A.AccountSeqID
	WHERE AB.UniqueAccountSeqId IS NULL 

	IF(@NumberOfBackBilledRecords <> @Zero)
	BEGIN
		INSERT INTO Billing.AccountBillingElectric
			(AdjustedAccountElectric,
			OriginalAccountNumber, 
			MonthlyAccountBillingChargesElectric,
			AccountBillingRowState, 
			BillingPeriod, 
			BillingPeriodRevision,
			DeliveryTariffRate, DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate, 
			CommodityTariffRate, CommodityTariffEffectiveDate, LoadFactor, BillCreationDate, PostMarkDate, DatePaymentDue, DateAcceptanceIntoOEC, 
			PreviousAccountBalance, FuelAdjustmentAmount, 
			LatePaymentAmount,
			ArrearAmount,
			CreditedPaidAmount, 
			CreditedPaymentDate, 
			DiscountPercentage, 
			DDDSurchargeAmount, DDDSurchargePercentage, DeliveryConsumption, DeliveryConsumptionOffPeak, 
			DeliveryConsumptionShoulder, DeliveryDemand, DeliveryDemandOffPeak, DeliveryDemandShoulder, DeliveryStreetLightingFacilityPoints, 
			CommodityConsumption, CommodityConsumptionOffPeak, CommodityConsumptionShoulder, CommodityDemand, CommodityDemandOffPeak, 
			CommodityDemandShoulder, CommodityFacilityPoints, GrossReceiptTax, GRTRate,
			EnergyCostAdjustment, EnergyCostAdjustmentPercentage, AccountEnergyUsage, AccountDemandUsage, 
			InitialPostingDate, Notes, AuthenticatedUserID, DateAdded, LastUpdate,
			LastPeriodModified, IsTimeOfDayAccount, UtilityCompanySeqid,
			CustomerMinimumCharge, IsMinimumBilledCharged, MinimumBilledEnergyDollars, 
			MinimumBilledDemandDollars, MaxBilledDemandPeriod, MaxBilledDemandUsage, IsSpannedPeriodBill, DeliveryFacilityPointsAmount, 
			FireAuditTrigger)
		SELECT DISTINCT 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid, --AccountBillingElectric.AdjustedAccountElectric, 
			A.OriginalAccountNumber,
			AB.AccountBillingSeqid, --@CurrentAccountBillingSeqid
			2, --AccountBillingElectric.AccountBillingRowState, Assume Update even if it did not exist
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, -- @BillingPeriod Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision, --@RevisedBillingPeriod,
			A.DeliveryTariffRate, A.DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate, A.CommodityTariffRate, A.CommodityTariffEffectiveDate,
			[dbo].[CalculateLoadFactor] (AB.AccountEnergyUsage, AB.AccountDemandUsage, AB.FromDate, AB.ToDate), -- AccountBillingElectric.LoadFactor, 
			@BillCreationDate, -- BillCreationDate, 
			@PostMarkDate, --AccountBillingElectric.PostMarkDate
			@DatePaymentDue, -- AccountBillingElectric.DatePaymentDue, 
			@DateAcceptanceIntoOEC, -- AccountBillingElectric.DateAcceptanceIntoOEC, 
			0.00, --AccountBillingElectric.PreviousAccountBalance, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.FuelAdjustmentAmount,
			0.00, --AccountBillingElectric.LatePaymentAmount, 
			0.00, --AccountBillingElectric.ArrearAmount, 
			0.00, --AccountBillingElectric.CreditedPaidAmount, -- Updated later from the invoice file
			0.00, --AccountBillingElectric.CreditedPaymentDate, -- Updated later from the invoice file
			0.00, --AccountBillingElectric.DiscountPercentage, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DDDSurchargeAmount, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DDDSurchargePercentage, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryConsumption, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryConsumptionOffPeak, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryConsumptionShoulder, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryDemand, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryDemandOffPeak, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryDemandShoulder, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryStreetLightingFacilityPoints, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityConsumption, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityConsumptionOffPeak, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityConsumptionShoulder, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityDemand, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityDemandOffPeak, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityDemandShoulder, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CommodityFacilityPoints, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.GrossReceiptTax, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.GRTRate, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.EnergyCostAdjustment, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.EnergyCostAdjustmentPercentage, 
			AB.AccountEnergyUsage, AB.AccountDemandUsage, 
			AB.InitialPostingDate, 
			null, --AccountBillingElectric.Notes, 
			AB.AuthenticatedUserID, AB.DateAdded, AB.LastUpdate,
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsTimeOfDayAccount, Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid,
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.CustomerMinimumCharge,
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsMinimumBilledCharged, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.MinimumBilledEnergyDollars, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.MinimumBilledDemandDollars, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.MaxBilledDemandPeriod, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.MaxBilledDemandUsage,
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.IsSpannedPeriodBill, 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.DeliveryFacilityPointsAmount, 
			'N' -- Do not FireAuditTrigger
		FROM 
			Billing.AccountBilling AS AB
			INNER JOIN Billing.Account AS A ON AB.UniqueAccountSeqId = A.UniqueAccountSeqId AND A.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added on 12/13/2018 */
			INNER JOIN Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling ON A.UniqueAccountSeqid = Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqid AND A.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added on 12/13/2018 */ LEFT JOIN
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric INNER JOIN
			Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision <> Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod ON 
			Nypa.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid AND 
			AB.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
			AB.BillingPeriod = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
			A.UtilityAccountProvider = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid AND 
			A.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalAccountNumber LEFT JOIN
			Billing.AccountBillingElectric ON AB.AccountBillingSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingElectric.MonthlyAccountBillingChargesElectric
		WHERE
			(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y') AND
			(Billing.AccountBillingElectric.AccountBillingElectricSeqid IS NULL) AND
			(AB.AccountBillingSeqid IS NOT NULL) AND
			(AB.AccountBillingStatus = 'BA')

		SET @NumberOfBackBilledElectricRecords = @@rowcount;

		UPDATE Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric
		SET 
			ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod ='Y',
			AdjustedAccount = A.AccountSeqid, 
			AdjustedAccountBill = AB.AccountBillingSeqid, 
			AdjustedAccountBillElectric = Billing.AccountBillingElectric.AccountBillingElectricSeqid,
			LastUpdate = getDate(),
			AuthenticatedUserID = @AuthenticatedUserID,
			UniqueAccountSeqID = A.UniqueAccountSeqid /* added on 12/20/2018 */
		FROM 
			Billing.AccountBilling AS AB
			INNER JOIN Billing.Account AS A ON AB.UniqueAccountSeqId = A.UniqueAccountSeqId and A.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added on 12/13/2018 */
			INNER JOIN NYPA.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling ON A.UniqueAccountSeqid = NYPA.UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.UniqueAccountSeqid  and A.IsCurrentRecord = 'Y' /* added on 12/13/2018 */
			LEFT JOIN Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric
			INNER JOIN Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame ON Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriod = Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod AND 
			Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision <> Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.BillingPeriod ON 
			UploadNypaBackAccountBilling.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectricSeqid AND 
			AB.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
			AB.BillingPeriod = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
			A.UtilityAccountProvider = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid AND 
			A.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentElectric.OriginalAccountNumber LEFT JOIN
			Billing.AccountBillingElectric ON AB.AccountBillingSeqid = AccountBillingElectric.MonthlyAccountBillingChargesElectric
		WHERE
			(Billing.ApplicationTimeFrame.CurrentProcessingPeriod = 'Y') AND 
			(Billing.AccountBillingElectric.AccountBillingElectricSeqid IS not NULL) AND 
			(AB.AccountBillingSeqid IS NOT NULL) AND 
			(AB.AccountBillingStatus = 'BA')
	
		SET @NumberOfBackBilledAdjustmentElectricRecords = @@rowcount;
	END;
END;
